glsa.title: Squid: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been found in Squid which make it susceptible to Denial of Service attacks.

background.p: Squid is a multi-protocol proxy server.

description.p: Squid fails to correctly handle ftp:// URI's. There is also an error in the external_acl queue which can cause an infinite looping condition.

impact.p: An attacker could attempt to retrieve a specially crafted URI via a Squid server causing the service to crash. If an attacker could generate a sufficiently high load on the Squid services, they could cause a Denial of Service by forcing Squid into an infinite loop.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
